oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Order to attend a national salute in honor of Bragg's victory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Asst. Adj. General J. M. Brandon sent this note to Lt. J. Wood Coleman to bring his battery in to town to attend a salute in honor of Gen. Braxton Bragg's victory. Coleman was ordered to meet another group at the brick kiln by the college building to fire the salute. This salute was for Bragg's victory at Chickamauga in September 1863.
